title: Vigilante biker pulls up and starts harassing a driver by aggressively revving his engine
text:
A vigilante biker revs his engine to the maximum to harass a driver using his mobile phone on the road.

The biker pulls up alongside a man in a red convertible taking a phone call in a traffic jam on Outwood Road, Manchester.

As the biker stops alongside him he revs his engine to the maximum causing the driver to laugh at his bizarre tactic.

Footage shows the driver in the sunglasses continue talking on the phone as the motorbike engine reaches a deafening sound.

The traffic jam build up along Outwood Road in Manchester as the driver in a red convertible (second car) takes a phone with his engine still running

A motorbike drives stops alongside the man seen with a phone to his ear as the cars are at a standstill

The driver laughs at the biker as he revs his engine to the maximum to catch his attention

Seconds later the driver ends the phone call and asks the biker what he is doing.

The biker says: 'Just because your not moving doesn't mean nobody else is.

'I am in a traffic jam', the driver replies.

The biker retorts: 'Don't matter its still illegal. Kids, pedestrians, motorcyclists and cyclists are still moving around you - get off your phone you d***.'

Finally the driver ends the call and the biker tells him: 'Just because your not moving doesn't mean nobody else is'

At this point the cars in front of the driver have moved further down the residential road causing the man to hold up cars behind him.

The biker then revs once more and drives off shouting 'k***head'
description: A vigilante biker pulls up alongside a man in a red convertible and revs his engine to the maximum while the driver takes a phone call in a traffic jam on Outwood Road, Manchester.
